thread.title: Israel reimposes ban on men under 50 from Aqsa Friday prayer - Region - World
thread.title_full: Israel reimposes ban on men under 50 from Aqsa Friday prayer - Region - World - Ahram Online

author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Israel reimposes ban on men under 50 from Aqsa Friday prayer - Region - World
text:
Related Palestinian killed by Israeli forces in Jerusalem clashes: Medics Arab League chief condemns 'racist' Israeli practices Israeli Arab lawmakers vow to defy Al-Aqsa ban Palestinians: Israel to destroy homes of alleged militants Israel lifts restrictions on Muslim prayer at Al-Aqsa: Police Israeli police said they would reimpose a ban on men under the age of 50 attending Friday Muslim prayers at Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound after a new wave of violence that killed at least seven Palestinians and four Israelis over the past week .
"It has been decided to limit the age of worshippers allowed entry to the Temple Mount to men over 50," a statement said Thursday, using the site's Hebrew name.
"Entry of women of all ages will be allowed."
*The story was edited by Ahram Online.
